citations.narrative:
In the walk through area of the park, an enclosure housing two peacocks has a wooden floor in need of repair. The
section of wall in the same corner is also in disrepair. These areas need to be structurally sound to protect and contain the
enclosed animals.
Correct by 20 December 2023

In the walk through area of the facility, a pen housing a goat and two ponies was not being maintained properly. In the
shelter of the corral there were multiple exposed sharp points within reach of the animal. The corral fence is wire strands
with vertical wooden branches, and in at least two places vertical branches were missing. This created gaps through
which the goat could easily leave the enclosure and wander the grounds. All enclosures must protect and safely contain
the enclosed animals. The sharp points must be removed, and the fence secured.
Corrected at time of inspection
In the cavy winter quarters, the wooden floor is in disrepair in several spots. One area has broken/splintered wood, and
another has a missing board creating a gap in the floor. The wall next to their water receptacle is covered with a layer of
chicken wire which has peeled loose at the bottom, exposing multiple sharp points. All unsafe areas of flooring need to be
replaced or repaired, and the exposed sharp points should be removed or secured.
Corrected at time of inspection

An Amazon parrot housed in the gift shop had access to power cords for a radiant heater and a heat lamp. Both were
plugged in to a wall outlet in the enclosure. Amazon parrots have powerful beaks and could easily chew through a
standard power cord. This poses a risk of injury to the enclosed bird. The facility must ensure that the enclosure is safe for
the animal. Power cords should be protected securely or in a location the bird cannot access.
Corrected at time of inspection

In the walk through area of the facility two enclosures housing emus and peacocks had dirty water receptacles that
appear to have not been cleaned or changed for at least several days. This poses a risk of contamination to the enclosed
birds. Water receptacles for birds must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from
contamination.
Corrected at time of inspection
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
